Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos or krater; interior glazed black with added red band near top; exterior: band of short tongues at top of shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of panther and bird to right (of panther, head, shoulder with red and part of chest with red remaining; of bird, wing with red); at left, perhaps part of panther's tail.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1202)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: UCL n 15 (Other Accession Number)
